item.title: [SERIND] SER Industries Ltd: Appointment of New Directors, Changes in Designation, and Proposed Acquisitions
item.description:
SER Industries Ltd has announced several significant changes and proposals in its recent board meeting. The board approved the appointment of Mr. Ayush Munnalal Sharma as an Additional Director (Non-Executive and Independent) for a term of 5 years. Mr. Sunil Kumar Shahi's designation was changed from Executive Director to Managing Director and Chairman of the Company for a term of 5 years. The board also approved the appointment of Mr. Shrenik Rajiv Karnawat as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Furthermore, the board considered increasing the authorized capital from Rs. 6,00,00,000 to Rs. 46,00,00,000 and approved the proposal to be placed before the shareholders. The board also approved the limits of INR 200 Crores for proposals requiring authorisation under Section 180(1)(a) and Section 180(1)(c) of the Companies Act, 2013. The board also approved granting of loans, guarantees, providing securities, or making investments exceeding the prescribed limits under Section 186 up to INR 800 Crores, subject to shareholder approval. The board also approved the proposed acquisition of upto 100% of SNA Milk and Milk Products Limited and DFSU Farmer Connect Private Limited against share swap by way issuance of securities of the Company on a preferential basis.

  • Appointment of Mr. Ayush Munnalal Sharma as Additional Director
  • Change in designation of Mr. Sunil Kumar Shahi to Managing Director and Chairman
  • Appointment of Mr. Shrenik Rajiv Karnawat as CFO
  • Proposal to increase authorized capital
  • Approval of limits for proposals under Section 180(1)(a) and Section 180(1)(c)

item.title: [ORIENTTR] Orient Tradelink Ltd Allots 3,32,454 Equity Shares at INR 22 Each, Increasing Paid-Up Equity Share Capital
item.description:
Orient Tradelink Ltd has allotted 3,32,454 equity shares of INR 10 each at a price of INR 22 per share, comprising of a premium of INR 12 per share. The allotment was made to six allottees: Sunita Panwar, Shikha, Bhawna Shadija, Bhim Raj Singh, Vivek Giri Maharaj, and Alisha. The paid-up equity share capital of the company has increased from INR 38,35,31,340 to INR 38,68,55,880 as a result of this allotment. The allotment was approved in a board meeting held on Tuesday, 20th January 2026.

item.title: [SERIND] SER Industries Ltd Announces Preferential Issue of Securities, Changes in Designation, and Acquisitions
item.description:
SER Industries Ltd has announced a series of decisions in its board meeting held on Tuesday, 20th January 2026. The board has approved a change in designation of Mr. Sunil Kumar Shahi from Executive Director to Managing Director and Chairman of the Company for a term of 5 years. The board has also approved the appointment of Mr. Shrenik Rajiv Karnawat as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Mr. Ayush Munnalal Sharma as an Additional Director (Non-Executive and Independent) for a term of 5 years. The board has also decided to place a revised proposal before the shareholders for an increase in the Authorized Share Capital of the Company. The board has evaluated and approved certain proposals under Section 180(1)(a) and Section 180(1)(c) of the Companies Act, 2013. The board has also approved granting of loans, guarantees, providing securities, or making investments exceeding the prescribed limits under Section 186. The company has also approved the proposed acquisition of upto 100% of SNA Milk and Milk Products Limited and DFSU Farmer Connect Private Limited against share swap by way issuance of securities of the Company on a preferential basis.

  • Change in designation of Mr. Sunil Kumar Shahi to Managing Director and Chairman
  • Appointment of Mr. Shrenik Rajiv Karnawat as CFO
  • Appointment of Mr. Ayush Munnalal Sharma as Additional Director
  • Proposed increase in Authorized Share Capital
  • Approval of proposals under Section 180(1)(a) and Section 180(1)(c) of the Companies Act, 2013
  • Approval of granting of loans, guarantees, providing securities, or making investments exceeding the prescribed limits under Section 186

item.title: [RBA] Open Offer by Lenexis Foodworks Private Limited and Others for 26.00% Stake in Restaurant Brands Asia Limited
item.description:
Lenexis Foodworks Private Limited, Aayush Agrawal Trust, Inspira Foodworks Private Limited, and Aayush Madhusudan Agrawal, along with Inspira Agro Trading LLC as a person acting in concert, have announced an open offer to acquire up to 20,80,61,717 Equity Shares of Restaurant Brands Asia Limited at a price of INR 70.00 per Equity Share. The total consideration for the offer is up to INR 14,56,43,20,190. The offer is made in accordance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011.

item.title: [SIELFNS] CMX Holdings Ltd to Approve Q3 and Nine Months Results on January 27, 2026
item.description:
CMX Holdings Ltd has announced that its Board of Directors will meet on January 27, 2026, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The meeting is scheduled in accordance with Regulation 29 and other applicable provisions of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. Furthermore, in compliance with the SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015, as amended, and the Company's Code of Conduct, the trading window for dealing in securities of the Company will be closed from January 01, 2026, and will reopen on January 30, 2026, 48 hours after the results are made public.

  • CMX Holdings Ltd to consider and approve unaudited financial results for Q3 and nine months ended December 31, 2025
  • Board Meeting scheduled on January 27, 2026
  • Trading window for securities to be closed from January 01, 2026, to January 30, 2026

item.title: [HINDPETRO] Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd Promotes Six Employees as Executive Directors
item.description:
Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd (HPCL) has announced the promotion of six employees as Executive Directors (EDs) with immediate effect. The new EDs are CR Vijaya Kumar, Manoj Kumar, C V Mallinath, Debasish Basak, Sanjay Mathur, and Mathew Sibi T. CR Vijaya Kumar will oversee Retail and East Central Zone, Manoj Kumar will handle Internal Engineering Projects & Facilities Planning, C V Mallinath will be responsible for Special Projects (Marketing) & Brand Promotion Management, Debasish Basak will manage Retail and HQO, Sanjay Mathur will handle Industrial & Consumers Promotion, and Mathew Sibi T will oversee Aviation. AS Reddy, Arvind Shastry, and Neeraj K Rai have also been promoted but their specific roles are not mentioned in the text.

  • Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd promotes six employees as Executive Directors
  • CR Vijaya Kumar to oversee Retail and East Central Zone
  • Manoj Kumar to handle Internal Engineering Projects & Facilities Planning
  • C V Mallinath to be responsible for Special Projects (Marketing) & Brand Promotion Management
  • Debasish Basak to manage Retail and HQO
  • Sanjay Mathur to handle Industrial & Consumers Promotion
  • Mathew Sibi T to oversee Aviation
